perturbation.original_text: 3.5. Due Date for Payment. Your Royalty payments and Advertising Contributions are due by the first (1st) day after the end of each Period (or the next business day if the first day is a Sunday or federal holiday) (as of the Agreement Date, the due date is Monday of each week). You must pay all other amounts due to us as specified in this Agreement or, if no time is specified, such amounts are due upon receipt of an invoice from us.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.5. Due Date for Payment. Your Royalty payments and Advertising Contributions are due by the first (1st) day after the end of each Period (or the next business day if the first day is a Sunday or federal holiday) (as of the Agreement Date, the due date is Monday of each week). You must pay all other amounts due to us as specified in this Agreement or, if no time is specified, such amounts are due within 30 days upon receipt of an invoice from us.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a direct contradiction. The original text specifies that all amounts due other than Royalty and Advertising Contributions are due upon receipt of an invoice, while the modified text states these other amounts are due within 30 days of receipt. This creates uncertainty about the actual payment deadline, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 4.3 Location Development and Preparation. You must construct, furnish, and open the Franchised Business as required by this Agreement and must open the Franchised Business not later than six (6) months after securing the necessary authorization and approval for permits and/or certificates. Time is of the essence.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.3 Location Development and Preparation. You must construct, furnish, and open the Franchised Business as required by this Agreement and must open the Franchised Business not later than twelve (12) months after securing the necessary authorization and approval for permits and/or certificates. Time is of the essence.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation creates a contradiction concerning the deadline to open the franchised business. The original text stipulates a six-month timeframe, while the modified version extends this period to twelve months. This inconsistency leads to uncertainty regarding the enforceable deadline, increasing the likelihood of disputes over timely compliance with the franchise agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 15.3. Termination by Us Following Expiration of Cure Period for Monetary Default. You will be in default under this Agreement if you fail, refuse, or neglect to pay when due (including if we are not able to collect payments by electronic fund transfer pursuant to Section 3.6 [Method of Payment] due to insufficient funds in your account(s), closure of your account(s), or any other reason resulting in the nonpayment) any monies owing to us, our affiliates, or any lender that has provided financing to you under this Agreement or any other agreement, or to your landlord and/or any supplier of goods or services to your Franchised Business. You will have ten (10) days after written notice of such default from us within which to remedy the default.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.3. Termination by Us Following Expiration of Cure Period for Monetary Default. You will be in default under this Agreement if you fail, refuse, or neglect to pay when due (including if we are not able to collect payments by electronic fund transfer pursuant to Section 3.6 [Method of Payment] due to insufficient funds in your account(s), closure of your account(s), or any other reason resulting in the nonpayment) any monies owing to us, our affiliates, or any lender that has provided financing to you under this Agreement or any other agreement, or to your landlord and/or any supplier of goods or services to your Franchised Business. You will have thirty (30) days after written notice of such default from us within which to remedy the default.
perturbation.explanation: This edit introduces conflicting information regarding the period allowed to resolve monetary defaults. While the unaltered text mandates resolution within a ten-day timeframe post notification, the altered text permits a thirty-day window for rectification. This contradiction undermines the clear terms of enforcement and generates disputes around default periods.
